reference.title: javaTransientField
reference.shortdesc: The <javaTransientField> element declares within the FieldModifiersopt that the fields introduced by the declaration are marked transient fields.

refbody.section: DescriptionThis element specifies that the value of the field should not be serialized. The variables can be marked transient to indicate that they are not part of the persistent state of an object. Possible alternative definitions of the FieldModifier declaration are the <javaStaticField>, <javaFinalField>, and <javaVolatileField> elements. The <javaSynchronizedMethod> element has the following predefined attributes:name ="transient" and value ="transient".
refbody.example:
ExampleClick on the following link to open the Java API topic type example in
<javaField id="javax.swing.plaf.TabbedPaneUI"> <apiName>calcRect</apiName> <shortDesc> A rectangle used for general layout calculations in order to avoid constructing many new rectangles automatically. </shortDesc> <javaFieldDetail> <javaFieldDef> <javaTransientField/> <javaFieldAccess value="protected"/> <javaFieldClass href=”http://java.sun.com/…/awt/Rectangle.html” format=”html” scope=”external”>Rectangle</javaFieldClass> </javaFieldDef> </javaFieldDetail> </javaField>
